app.name: MyTextTwister
app.tweet: Express yourself with MyTextTwister & send out a ʎzɐɹɔ holiday cheer with special effect texts, 1200+ emoticons, cute art!
app.thebottomline: Embellish your SMS and e-mails with various text effects.
app.thegoods:
• Many options available for just plain text – Two text boxes appear on the main screen: Your Text, the text box on the left, is where you enter your message, and Twisted Text, the text box on the right, is where you can preview the text effect or “Twisting Logic” that you have chosen from the selection at the bottom of the main screen. You can select from five different text effects.
  • Metro Style implementation – This very intuitive application follows Metro design principlesMetro is the new design language created by Microsoft for the Windows Phone 7 interface. in a delightful way: All the functions you need are in the application bar, and the decoration categories are easily accessible in a pivot page, which makes navigation very easy.
  • Easily share your Twisted Text via SMS or e-mail – After embellishing your text, you can easily send it to others via SMS or e-mail.
  • Cost – It’s free*!
app.thebads: • The original review posted on December 7, 2012, has been edited: A recent update adds an autocomplete functionality that is now available when texting. In addition, we’ve confirmed that the separate message threads created when texting with this application are only temporary; once messages are successfully sent, they are automatically added to the master thread and the separate threads are deleted. We’ve also retracted our comment about Twisted Texts being easily overwritten; the developer explains that Twisted Texts are deliberately easy to edit for users to conveniently modify, copy, and paste content to other applications, and that accidentally deleted Twisted Texts can be quickly retrieved by adding or deleting a single character in the left text box (Your Text).
app.theuglys: • We could not find anything ugly about this delightful app. If you discover something that could be improved with this app, please contact us and we will consider adding it to this post.
app.theamazings:
• Add ASCII art to your messages – Once you tap on the Decorate icon in the application bar, you can embellish your messages with over 35 different ASCII art effects, including very elaborate pictures that can take up to twelve lines in your text message.
  • Holiday Greetings – A category dedicated to holiday greetings can be found in the Decoration section of this application. There are greetings for Easter, Halloween, and Valentine’s Day. My personal favorite is the Christmas greeting composed of a house in the middle of a snow storm.

app.name: Snow Day!
app.tweet: Tap away snowflakes & snowballs to keep a snowbank from getting too high in the fun Christmas-themed game Snow Day!

app.tweet: Check out Kitten Videos 1! It features the best videos of the cutest felines—all sorted into 6 fun categories!

app.name: Christmas Presents
app.tweet: Fret no more this holiday! Easily manage ur to do list using Christmas Presents. Track ur $, gifts, names, & more!

app.name: BlocksLAN
app.tweet: Miss Tetris? Try BlocksLAN! Make the most rows & take advantage of block-breaking "spells." Solo mode available!

app.name: Christmas Bells Free
app.tweet: A caroling we will go! Play a holiday tune with lyrics using Christmas Bells. Great app to ring in the holiday spirit!

app.name: Start Slideshow
app.tweet: Start Slideshow turns your pictures hub into a fun slideshow of memories—w/ speech navigation & view options, too!

app.name: Rhyming with Palmer
app.tweet: Get kids rhyming w/ Rhyming with Palmer! It also develops their auditory memory & ability to hear sounds in words!

app.name: Sound Meditation
app.tweet: Sound Meditation's custom sound compilations & meditation guide will help you escape the chaos of everyday life!

app.name: Gifts
app.tweet: Gifts—The ideal gift list! Easy to sort & share. Also, keep track of your budget by checking prices on-line!
app.thebottomline: A check list of your holiday gifts.
app.thegoods:
• Flawless design and user interface – This Christmas list has not only a very stylish design but also a very intuitive user interface. All the functions are in the application bar, and you can easily add new items to the list without going to another screen.
  • Sorting and sharing features – You can easily sort items according to the dates they were added, the recipients, or the prices. You can also share a selected item or the entire list via e-mail or SMS.
  • Calculates gift prices for you – You can specify the prices of the gifts. Two fields, Total Cost and Total Spent, at the bottom of the list automatically show the total price of the gifts on the list and the gifts you already bought. Once you check off a gift on the list, its price is added to the amount in the Total Spent field.
  • Cost – It’s free!
app.thebads:
• Sharing via e-mail – When you share lists via e-mail, the app sends out improperly formatted e-mails containing visible HTML tags (e.g., <p>).
  • Room for improvement: Duplicate and picture features – Entries must be duplicated manually if you want give the same gift to more than one person, so a duplicate function would be very useful. Another simple yet useful function would be for assigning pictures to the items; this is particularly useful when you have yet to decide what gifts you will give.
app.theuglys: • We could not find anything ugly about this delightful app. If you discover something that could be improved with this app, please contact us and we will consider adding it to this post.
app.theamazings:
• Price finder – Once you tap on the price icon in the application bar, the item you have selected from the list is searched online. The app redirects you to Google Shopping page where you can view all the items with the same name as you selected item, including their prices.
  • Christmas countdown timer – The number of days left before Christmas can be seen on the upper right corner of the list.

app.name: Mr. Snowman
app.tweet: Does your snowman have hair? Is it happy or sad? You choose! Tons of fun creating your very own with Mr Snowman!

app.name: Paper Snow
app.tweet: Its a jolly time making paper snowflakes w/Paper Snow!Put on ur own pics or choose from Xmas backgrounds & share!

app.name: SmartKid Maths
app.tweet: Try SmartKid Maths: It's a COPPA-compliant app w/ 1000s of exercises perfect for preschoolers & 1st/2nd graders!

app.name: AlphaMatch Christmas
app.tweet: Match letters/objects to each other or their first-letter sounds in the themed memory game AlphaMatch Christmas!

app.name: Holidays Slurpy
app.tweet: Preschoolers learn with Slurpy the Frog playing Holidays Slurpy! Easy to follow yet challenging page-turning activities.

app.name: Sleigh
app.tweet: Dash over hills of snow thru many levels to help Santa find the lost presents & his reindeer with Sleigh!

app.name: Duckie Deck Collection
app.tweet: It's never too early to learn daily life skills! DuckieDeck teaches problem solving skills with mini toddler games!

app.name: Catching Cars
app.tweet: Do you stand by the highway and watch passing cars until you become nauseous and your eyes hurt? This game is for you!

app.name: Train Crazy
app.tweet: Customize a moving train with new bells, colors, cars & more with Train Crazy! Collect all the modifications!

app.name: Slurpy the Frog Free
app.tweet: Slurpy the Frog teaches kids about shapes, sizes, relationships & world facts. Challenging games, colorful graphics!

app.name: Jigsolve Me!
app.tweet: Jigsolve Me is a free jigsaw-puzzle app that uses the WHOLE screen. Adjustable difficulty & personalized puzzles!

app.name: Telling The Time
app.tweet: Telling The Time's fun tests teach kids to tell the time on analog & digital clocks in the 12- OR 24-hour format!

app.name: Immunization Record
app.tweet: No need to call the Dr! Have your children’s medical info in the palm of your hand with Immunization Record

app.name: Kleio Free
app.tweet: Learning on-the-go just got easy with Kleio Free’s Sophisticated Study Method which adjusts its difficulty as you learn!

app.name: Toy Xylophone
app.tweet: Kids will love Toy Xylophone! Fingers tapping away to Holiday & familiar folk songs on the coolest little keyboard!
app.thebottomline: A toy xylophone that teaches you to play known children’s songs.
app.thegoods:
• Play your own compositions or listen to those on the auto-play list – Little ones can play their own compositions or listen to the xylophone play various, known children’s songs. In auto-play mode, the xylophone also highlights the keys to hit so that children can learn to play.
  • Great user interface with the right amount of controls – This application is very well designed. All the controls you need are available on the top of the screen. You can surf the playlist, pause or stop a song, mute the sounds, change the tempo, and even change the color of the xylophone keys.
  • Two octaves and multi-touch – Not only does this adorable toy xylophone have two octaves for you to play many songs, but it also has multi-touch support in case your little musician wants to get fancy and play more than one note at a time
  • Cost – It’s free*!
app.thebads: • Room for improvement: Tutorial mode – It would be great if this application had a tutorial mode in which the highlighted key need to be hit before the next note is played. Changing the tempo can slow down songs, but it may still be too fast for your little one to catch on.
app.theuglys: • Application crashes when returning from lock screen – This application doesn’t run under screen lock, which is especially frustrating when the screen suddenly locks during auto-play mode. The application attempts to resume after unlocking the screen, but it eventually crashes.
app.theamazings: • Large international repertoire – The playlist contains 90 songs from over 15 countries, from Australia to Mexico. You can play classics such as “Twinkle Twinkle Little Star” and “The Alphabet Song” or Christmas favorites such as “Frosty the Snowman,” “Silent Night,” and “Twelve Days of Christmas.”

app.name: Christmas
app.tweet: Seasons Greetings texts, gift list, countdown the days til Xmas & ringtone in the holiday spirit with Christmas app!

app.name: Budget Buddy
app.tweet: Who needs an accountant? Or paperwork to bother with? Budget Buddy tracks, analyzes & can snap pics of your spending!

app.name: Baby Lullaby
app.tweet: Baby Lullaby helps create calm environments for your baby with music box songs, soothing soundscapes or your recorded voice

app.name: Fun Voice
app.tweet: Sound like a robot, buzz like a bee, speak slow like a turtle! Record, playback & share for more laughs with Fun Voice!

app.name: Cartoon Tube WP7
app.tweet: YouTube’s cool,but not all is for li’l eyes to see. What to do?Try YouTube Junior! Fun for kids, peace of mind for parents.

app.name: ParentAssist
app.tweet: ParentAssist tracks kids' feeding/sleep sched, diaper changes, med history & more—custom charts/reports available!

app.name: Pandoodle
app.tweet: Connect shapes w/color lines by linking them & intersect them to create new colors w/ Pandoodle a fun tracing game

app.name: CatCentrate!
app.tweet: Like cats & playing memory games? Check out CatCentrate: it's the perfect game app for cat lovers of all ages!

app.name: Math Knockout
app.tweet: Play Math Knockout & make arithmetic fun: Just choose the right operations to combine numbers so they equal 1–24!

app.name: Sansu
app.tweet: Choose numbers to add/subtract/multiply/divide & complete equations as fast as you can in the fun math game Sansu!
app.thebottomline: Select up to five numbers to combine with any of the four basic operations (+, -, x , ÷) so that they first numbers equal the last number.
app.thegoods:
• Lots of customization options, levels & rewards – You can quickly set up the game sounds, minimize or maximize the game board size, and change the game’s difficulty level to Fun, Thinking, or Serious. Each level has unique features to suit the player’s ability (e.g., Fun offers hints every five seconds, Thinking offers a limited number of hints, and Serious offers no hints at all). Our favourite feature is the rewards available on Fun mode, which give extra points or time if you use difficult numbers in the problem, making the game challenging yet fun and encouraging.
  • Great implementation of Metro design – This application follows Metro design principles in a delightful way. It’s refreshing to see games implementing the Metro design, as it provides a sense of familiarity to the users and makes it easier for them to navigate thru the app, given that they are familiar with Metro design conventions.
  • Simple, clear instructions – The game is really straightforward and all the instructions are easy to understand, but in case you want to get all the details, there is a very helpful How to Play section that tells you everything you need to know.
  • Quiet ad-support – No annoying pop-ups or poorly placed advertisements that disrupt your game. The developer did a really good job at keeping the app free without sacrificing gameplay quality.
app.thebads:
• No multitasking support – The app does not tombstone properly, so if you’re in the middle of playing a game and you lock your phone, receive a call, or hit the Start screen button, you cannot pick up from where you left off and all your progress will be lost.
  • Hard-to-read text in Light theme – Very similar tones of font and background colours can make it hard to read certain texts (e.g., option names in Settings). It’s not terrible, but it would be great if the app could support the Light theme better.
app.theuglys: • We could not find anything ugly about this delightful app. If you discover something that could be improved with this app, please contact us and we will consider adding it to this post.
app.theamazings:
• Excellent leaderboards – The app does a very good job at showing how your scores compare with those of other players from all over the world. You can also pick any flag/country to go with your profile, so even if your current location is not your country, you can represent your country in the leaderboards.
  • All solutions available after each game – See other possible answers at the end of each game. The All Solutions page shows you all the different ways of making the correct solutions with the numbers that you were given, which can help you improve your math skills.

app.name: Toddler Paint
app.tweet: With no complex settings or drop-down boxes, Toddler Paint is one painting app that's truly for little ones. Try it today!
app.thebottomline: Toddler-friendly drawing app with a color picker right beside the canvas and easy settings to change the brush size and canvas color.
app.thegoods:
• Thoughtful settings – The app has simple, thoughtful options that allow kids to easily clear the screen, toggle the canvas color, and adjust the brush size according to their artistic abilities.
  • Ability to save the masterpiece – The app allows you to save your little one’s masterpiece to your phone so you can save it for prosperity or share it with the world.
  • Free with ad support or paid without ads – This app has an ad-supported free version and an ad-free paid version, which in our opinion is totally worth it if your toddler likes to paint!
app.thebads: • We could not find anything bad about this delightful app. If you discover something that could be improved with this app, please contact us and we will consider adding it to this post.
app.theuglys: • We could not find anything ugly about this delightful app. If you discover something that could be improved with this app, please contact us and we will consider adding it to this post.
app.theamazings:
• Color picker for parents to set up – Parents can choose the colors that go on each of the 10 spots in the color picker, as some kids prefer to use only certain colors. This, of course, would is something parents have to adjust, just like the brush thickness.
  • Truly made for toddler – The developer was inspired by his son, and it is very obvious to us that he has designed this app for users 18 months to 3 years of age. The app is very simple to use and it provides all the necessary controls for very small children to allow them to just concentrate on painting, not on complicated settings.

app.thebottomline: Toddler-friendly drawing app with a color picker right beside the canvas and easy settings to change the brush size and canvas color.

  • Truly made for toddler – The developer was inspired by his son, and it is very obvious to us that he has designed this app for users 18 months to 3 years of age. The app is very simple to use and it provides all the necessary controls for very small children to allow them to just concentrate on painting, not on complicated settings.

app.tweet: Instantly make your phone baby-friendly w/ Baby Toy Phone: it entertains kids w/ songs & big, adorable graphics!

app.tweet: Dolls are boring? Try Charlie Chucker & swing ragdolls in the wildest weather! It's 60 levels of unique physics fun!

app.name: Simplefects
app.tweet: Feeling creative? Make dancing graphics with Simplefects: Modify 18 visual effects with just a swipe of a finger!

app.name: Who Knew?
app.tweet: Ready to test your mastery of non–common sense knowledge? Checkout Who Knew? & learn a nice, new thing or two, today!

app.name: The Three Vampires
app.tweet: Encourage kids to read with The Three Vampires―an interactive, spooky-sweet reworking of Goldilocks's classic tale!

app.name: Spelling Assistant
app.tweet: Spelling Assistant can actually read your words aloud to test your spelling. Simply enter your words and tap!

app.name: Halloween (Puzzle)
app.tweet: Slide pieces of the puzzle to bring spooky pictures to life w/ Halloween (Puzzle)! Can you get thru all 3 levels?

app.name: 2-3 y.o.’s quiz Free
app.tweet: Handy to have for curious toddlers to play. 2-3 y.o.'s quiz Free keeps them engaged w/ this fun learning app!

app.name: Polyglot
app.tweet: Studying language? TRY Polyglot—it translates 30+ languages & supports translation playback & voice-to-text input!
app.thebottomline: Language translation app with text-to-speech and speech-to-text features.
app.thegoods:
• Translation for over 30 languages – Supported languages range from the most common (e.g., Chinese) to the more regional (e.g., Haitian Créole). This is definitely a must-have app for language learners or frequent travelers.
  • Neat, intuitive user interface – Everything is in one screen. With just a tap of your finger, you can switch the source and target languages, and activate the speech-to-text and text-to-speech translation features. You can also hide the language list-box if you want more space for the text.
  • Easily share translated text – Translated text can be shared via e-mail or text message.
  • No risk – Free trial available.
app.thebads: • Selecting a different target language doesn’t trigger automatic translation – Previous translations remain on the screen when you select a new target language. You must tap the translate button in the application bar to retranslate the source text.
app.theuglys: • We could not find anything ugly about this delightful app. If you discover something that could be improved with this app, please contact us and we will consider adding it to this post.
app.theamazings:
• Don’t type, just talk (not all languages supported) – Voice recognition is enabled for 15 languages, including Spanish, Italian, German, French, and Turkish.
  • Let the app talk for you (not all languages supported) – The app supports audio playback of translated text. It’s particularly useful when you’re learning to pronounce foreign words, or when you’re talking with anyone whose language you don’t know. Some of the languages this app “speaks” are Catalan, Danish, Dutch, Finnish, French, and German.

app.name: Whip Free
app.tweet: Let it whip w/ Whip Free just like Sheldon from Big Bang Theory "The Weekend Vortex" episode! Fun sound w/out pain!

app.name: 1App Budget
app.tweet: Manage finances with 1App Budget. You can even create graphs, set multiple budgets & use cloud storage!
app.thebottomline: Keep track of your finances including your accounts, balances, transactions and budgets
app.thegoods:
• Powerful sorting feature – Organize your accounts and transactions exactly the way you want. You can easily sort your data (in either ascending or descending order) according to name, category, date, amount, and check number.
  • Various balance modes – Choose among six available balance modes: Today Collected, Today Awaiting, Today Available, Final Collected, Final Awaiting, and Final Available. The different modes let you control how balances are displayed, and it’s easy to switch from one mode to another. You can instantly know how much money you currently have and will have in the bank, which is helpful if you want to make the best financial decisions.
  • Customizable charts – Quickly toggle between bar and pie charts to visually represent your accounts and transactions. You can also filter graphical data by specifying the date (i.e., start and end spans), transaction type, transaction account, and transaction category.
  • Cost – It’s free. Ads free!
app.thebads:
• Default transaction type – Transactions are positive by default. While easy to do, changing the transaction type can be very repetitious or even cumbersome especially for people recording in a hurry or people using the app specifically to monitor their expenses.
  • Slight lag on startup – The app is not as responsive as desired. You can set a default account to always start with, but you can’t do anything about random pages showing up on screen during startup. This isn’t a big deal if you don’t mind a startup delay of about three seconds, but seeing random pages on startup is irrelevant to the whole experience of using the app.
  • Room for improvement: More user-friendly Budget section – The separate Budget section for recording all budget-related transactions is an impressive addition, but it could use some improvement. For example, budget types are also positive by default; this automatically makes all of your entries income targets instead of spending budgets, which could be very confusing if you don’t realize the difference between the two. Moreover, budgets can be added to only one category, and they must be created before the expenses because existing expenses don’t show when linked to newly created budgets.
app.theuglys: • We could not find anything ugly about this delightful app. If you discover something that could be improved with this app, please contact us and we will consider adding it to this post.
app.theamazings:
• Cloud storage with Google Docs – All your information can be imported from and exported to Google spreadsheets, so in case you can’t use your phone, the information you save in this app can always be accessed online.
  • Great Metro design – The graphical design of this app matches your own phone’s theme. In addition, the user interface is very easy to navigate and a help section is always available if you ever get stuck along the way.

app.name: Trick Or Treat Concentration
app.tweet: Where are the matching spiderwebs? The pumpkins, skulls? Test your memory skills w/ Trick or Treat Concentration!

app.name: Funny Faces
app.tweet: Add effects to LIVE camera-shots & turn friends into clowns, chimps, or even Chuck Norrises with Funny Faces!
app.thebottomline: Add funny overlays to pictures while they’re being shot or after they’re saved.
app.thegoods:
• Over 200 possible overlay combinations – Jazz up any picture with more than 15 overlays, including masks, hairstyles, facial hair, and accessories. Use one effect or combine all the available effects to make hundreds of different modifications to your photos.
  • Automatic or manual photo modification – Manually add overlays, or let the app do everything for you. The app’s smart face-detection capability automatically places any overlay in the correct position, but you can also move, rotate, and resize the overlays yourself using simple touch gestures.
  • Save and share function – Save modified photos to the Pictures Hub, and share them via e-mail, Facebook, or Twitter. You can e-mail modified photos after saving them to the Pictures Hub, or share them directly on Facebook and Twitter.
  • No risk – Free trial available. The trial version enables some of the overlays and the one-time use of the share and save function.
app.thebads:
• No zoom capability – You can’t zoom in photos when you’re editing them. The absence of a zoom capability makes it hard to position some of the small overlays.
  • Room for improvement: More overlays enabled – It would be nice if there were more overlays available. This app has a lot of users asking for additional content!
app.theuglys: • We could not find anything ugly about this delightful app. If you discover something that could be improved with this app, please contact us and we will consider adding it to this post.
app.theamazings:
• Brilliant implementation of Augmented Reality – Add overlays to pictures while taking them with your phone’s rear or front camera—in either landscape or portrait orientation. Faces in live camera-shots are automatically detected and modified with the selected overlays, so you don’t have to save pictures before editing them.
  • Metro design and simple user interface – The app is easy to use, responsive, and uncluttered. You don’t have to deal with unnecessary or complex menus, so you can just focus on having fun with the app.

app.name: Critter Cards- Halloween
app.tweet: Kids will love Critter Cards-Halloween phone app learning vocabulary words w/ hauntingly silly talking flashcards.

app.name: SuDoKu4KiDS
app.tweet: SuDoKu4KIds is a simple version of Sudoku: fill 4x4 grids with numbers, shapes, animals, or even toys!

app.name: ArithmeTic-Tac-Toe
app.tweet: ArithmeTic-Tac-Toe teaches basic math thru 5 variations of the classic game. Fully customizable/animated!

app.name: Wiztiles Pro
app.tweet: Check out Wiztiles Pro & make task shortcuts to pin on the start screen! Live Tiles, downloadable themes & more!

app.name: Twelvo!
app.tweet: Twelvo! Sort numbered, irregularly shaped tiles from 1 to 12 in the fewest moves. Cute graphics, fun levels!

app.name: Translator ++
app.tweet: Translator++ uses both Bing & Google translators and also detects the language of any text!

app.name: ToyBank
app.tweet: Help kids save up & buy what they want with ToyBank! It tracks money savings using a fun, simple interface.

app.name: The real princess
app.tweet: e-book app - The real princess ("The Princess & the Pea"). Its illustrations come alive when tilted or tapped on!

app.name: Spoken Spellings
app.tweet: Record a set of words and quiz yourself once you are familiar with these words. A great study tool!

app.name: Spin and Spell
app.tweet: Make a fun game out of learning to construct simple Consonant-Vowel-Consonant (CVC) words with Spin and Spell.

app.name: Snake 8
app.tweet: The classic game Snake finally comes to Windows Phones as Snake 8 Free. Same gameplay, brand new features!

app.name: Paint and Puzzle
app.tweet: Color up to 50 unique images that can also be used as puzzles with Paint and Puzzle. Two activities in one!

app.name: My Rubber Duck
app.tweet: My Rubber Duck—a fun app that gives you a cute rubber ducky to squeeze right in your phone. Tub not required!

app.name: My Animal Age
app.tweet: How old are you in animal years? My Animal Age will tell you. 12 animal year calculations available!

app.name: Moody Marty
app.tweet: Record your moods or help your kids say theirs. Share moods via e-mail or social media too with Moody Marty!

app.name: Lightning Dial
app.tweet: Create your own shortcuts to send specific texts/e-mails, search specific queries & more with Lightning Dial!

app.name: Khan Academy
app.tweet: Get fast access to videos on KhanAcademy.org with Khan Academy & turn your phone into a mini-university!

app.name: Jack of Math
app.tweet: Improve and monitor your kids' math skills with Jack of Math. Customize the number range, the time limit and more!

app.name: Holidays Calendar
app.tweet: Know the most fun & popular holidays with Holidays Calendar. Live Tile support, 7 holiday categories & more!

app.name: Gem Lines 2
app.tweet: Fill your gem-matching needs w/ Gem Lines 2! Leaderboards, achievements, play modes, themes & gem sets available!

app.name: English Flashcards 1 from Langeroo
app.tweet: English Flashcards 1 from Langeroo with over 160 cards from 9 various topics. Flashcard Games also available!

app.name: Draw Free!
app.tweet: Make wonderful drawings and edit your pictures straight from your phone with Draw Free!

app.name: DoodlePad
app.tweet: Start with a blank canvas, or draw on your own photos with DoodlePad. Brush sizes/colors are customizable.

app.name: Croc Monsieur
app.tweet: Save Croc Monsieur from pain by pulling out his bad teeth. Don't pull the wrong tooth, though. He bites!

app.name: Color Me Free
app.tweet: Teach the ABCs, 123s & more while your child colors outlined or invisible mystery drawings. Fantastic art game!

app.name: Cinderella
app.tweet: Enjoy the magical tale of Cinderella. eBook app with a puzzle & multilingual audio!

app.name: Calorie Counter by FatSecret
app.tweet: FatSecret's Calorie Counter has a food guide, food/exercise diary, weight chart & journal to help you be fit!

app.name: Birthdays Diary
app.tweet: Very customizable events calendar w/ Facebook integration, Live Tile support & more!

app.name: Baby Cards Free
app.tweet: Baby Cards Free has a game, vocab library & interactive audio flash-cards in Japanese/Chinese/English!

app.name: Baby Book
app.tweet: Check out Baby Book! It records events, milestones & other important data. Add pics & view events in a time line!

app.name: Ava's ABC
app.tweet: Ava's ABC has Flash cards, vivid graphics, big fonts & more to help kids learn the ABCs. It also plays "The A.B.C."!

app.name: Alpha Match
app.tweet: Check out AlphaMatch - a matching game with a twist. Match images, small/capital letters & initial sounds!

app.name: Angelina
app.tweet: Dress up Angelina, the lovable tap-, ballet- & hip-hop-dancing mouse. Hundreds of possible outfit combinations!

app.name: 1tap2send
app.tweet: 1tap2send lets you pin pre-fabricated messages to your start screen so you can send them in seconds.

app.name: Alphabuzzle
app.tweet: Put uniquely shaped letter-tiles in the right order with Alphabuzzle. Get leaderboards & 100s of levels, too!

app.name: ABC Trace Free
app.tweet: ABC Trace Free helps kids improve hand-eye coordination while teaching the alphabet & basic vocab words

app.name: Abby In Wonderland
app.tweet: Have a magical read-out-loud experience exploring Wonderland with Elmo & his friends in Abby In Wonderland!

app.name: A+ Math Facts
app.tweet: Play a timed or relaxed multiple-choice math quiz with A+ Math Facts. Great for introducing kids to math!

app.name: Flowerz
app.tweet: The hit game Flowerz has a FREE APP! Match same-colored flowers, use butterflies & more—just like the web version!

app.name: mazoocard Lite
app.tweet: mazoocard LITE is a customizable memory game. Set the images on the cards, the number of cards to play & more!

app.name: App Discovery by Windows Phone Parent
app.tweet: Do you like our recommendations? Make sure to share our app with friends & family so they can also discover amazing WP apps!

app.name: CatAlarm!
app.tweet: Wake up to the cute sound of cats & kittens w/ CatAlarm! Various categorized cat sounds & settings included!

app.name: Stack the States
app.tweet: Learn state capitals, shapes, geographic locations and more. Touch, move and drop the animated states anywhere on the screen.

app.name: ReDraw!
app.tweet: Look at me & remember what you see! But be quick – w/ ReDraw! you have a blink of an eye to memorize what to draw!

app.name: Word Bubbles
app.tweet: Word Bubbles—Fun for toddlers and grownups too! Tots learn their ABC’s while offering older minds a challenge too!

app.name: Turkey Gobbler
app.tweet: Turkey Gobbler—Have your very own pet turkey on your phone & change its look or make it gobble!

app.name: Wonder Witches
app.tweet: Navigate dangerous, cloudy, lined skies as you collect floating potions & new broomsticks in Wonder Witches!

app.name: Plants vs. Zombies
app.tweet: The zombies are coming! Use your lawn plants to defeat them all in the award-winning TD game Plants vs. Zombies!

app.name: Pumpkin Smash
app.tweet: Stop Frankenstein's, Dracula's & more famous monsters' armies with flickable pumpkins in Pumpkin Smash! 30 levels!

app.name: Talking Pumpkin
app.tweet: Hear your voice in scary, Halloween-perfect audio with Talking Pumpkin—a fun recorder app with animated graphics!

app.name: Monster Island
app.tweet: Conquer your monster fears w/ the monster-bombing physics game Monster Island: 12 heroes & 252 levels to play!
